verbs.description: recalcitrate (third-person singular simple present recalcitrates, present participle recalcitrating, simple past and past participle recalcitrated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To kick back; to kick against anything.
(transitive, by extension) To express repugnance or opposition.
examples: The more one was indignant at being the object of such a man's contempt, the more heartily did one disdain his disdain, and recalcitrate his kicks.
